result.execSummary:
The defendant Devontae O'Dezen Bracken was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $671.29 payable to Monique F.  To be taken from bail on deposit.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Applicable fees, assessments, court costs and surcharges including a DNA assessment.  You may have to give a swab, which you might be able to have expunged under 165.77.
DOC to collect, after bail has been applied. Any remaining balance is to be returned to the person who posted bail.
Any monetary amounts ordered today at the rate of max 25% of any amounts provided in Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and 973.20 while the defendant is in their control. Any monetary amounts that remain unpaid when the defendant is released from confinement are to be paid as a condition of the Extended Supervision.  Any monetary amounts that remain unpaid when the sentence is completed are ordered reduced to a judgment against the defendant for the unpaid balance and collection can then proceed under Sec. 71.935 as well as other collection procedures.

superMiscConds.notes:
Maintain absolute sobriety.  
Comply with any treatment deemed necessary.
Undergo a mental health evaluation.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devontae O'Dezen Bracken

Per remittitur dated July 18, 2018, Appeal No. 2017AP000731 CRNM, IT IS ORDERD AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on June 4, 2018, that:  IT IS ORDERED that the judgment of conviction is summarily affirmed.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Erin K. Deeley is relieved of any further representation of Devontae ODezen Bracken on appeal.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(3).

records.addlTxt: per order dated June 4, 2018, Appeal No. 2017AP731-CRNM, IT IS ORDERED that the judgment of conviction is summarily affirmed. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Erin K. Deeley is relieved of any further representation of Devonte O'Dezen Bracken on appeal. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.32(3). IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.

Defendant Devontae O'Dezen Bracken in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Defendant Devontae O'Dezen Bracken in custody.  alex mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court goes over previously entered plea with the defendant.   
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 13 YEARS, with credit for 357 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 8 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and comply with any treatment deemed necessary.
Defendant to undergo a mental health evaluation.
NO CONTACT ORDER REMAINS
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Restitution (surcharges applicable) $671.29 payable to Monique F. to be taken from bail on deposit.
I am imposing the applicable fees, assessments, court costs, and surcharges, including a dna assessment.  And, you may have to give a swab, which you might be able to have expunged under 165.77.
I will order DOC to collect (after bail has been applied [any remaining balance is to be returned to the person who posted bail]) any monetary amounts ordered today at the rate of max 25% of any amounts provided in secs 973.05(4)(b) and 973.20 while the defendant is in their control.  Any monetary amounts that remain unpaid when the defendant is released from confinement are to be paid as a condition of the extended supervision.  Any monetary amounts that remain unpaid when the sentence is completed are ordered reduced to a judgment against the defendant for the unpaid balance and collection can then proceed under sec. 71.935 as well as other collection procedures.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Original transcript of Plea Hearing 8.9.16 (16 pages) received and filed.

Defendant Devontae O'Dezen Bracken in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Defendant Devontae O'Dezen Bracken in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The court will not proceed today with the defendant's plea.  Case adjourned to address whether a trial date will be set or defense counsel will withdraw.  Further proceedings scheduled for September 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Devontae O'Dezen Bracken in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  alex mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Robbery PTAC, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.32(1)(b), 939.50(3)(e), 939.05 a Felony E.
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  PSI was ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Eugene E. Detert in court, defendant Devontae O'Dezen Bracken not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Case set for final pretrial on 4-14-2016 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 5-11-2016 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  There are no custodial statements.
The court orders that the cash bail on deposit, $2500.00, is to be forfeited but HELD pending restitution determination.  The court sets $10,000.00 cash bail.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial and motion hearing. Defendant not in court. Court previously issued a bench warrant in this case due to Justice Point violations. State requested the jury trial date be vacated and the warrant remain outstanding. Defense counsel requested to withdraw the motion to suppress. Court denied defense motion and finds the defendant WAIVED the motion by his failure to appear. Court vacated the jury trial date of 10/19/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.

Case set on the calendar at defense counsel's request for the defendant to walk in on the warrant. Defense counsel checked in with the court earlier in the morning and the defendant had not appeared. Case remains in bench warrant status. Case remains scheduled for final pretrial on 8/26/15 and for jury trial on 10/19/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.
Justice Point Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Justice Point report - positive drug test - received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

No appearances made by either party. Defendant not in Court. 
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case called by the Court to address Justice Point violation - postive drug test. Defendant was ordered to report to Court to address the violation but absconded from Justice Point. Court ordered a bench warrant be issued. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court deferred ruling on cash bail posted until the next court date. Parties notified by the Clerk via email of the bench warrant. Cas remains scheduled for final pretrial on 8/26/15 and for jury trial on 10/19/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.
RECALL SUBPOENA.

Defendant Devontae O'Dezen Bracken in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense motion to withdraw the speedy jury trial (defendant now out of custody) and requested an adjournment of the motion hearing currently scheduled for today's date and of the jury trial.  State did not object.  Parties were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be transferred to the Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein. Branch 25, in Room G-55A of the Criminal Justice Facility.  All motions in limine, jury instructions, witness lists and completed substantive jury instructions must be filed with the court one (1) week prior to the final pretrial date.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Final pretrial and motion hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court, defendant Devontae O'Dezen Bracken not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Court set the following filing schedule for motions:  movant to file by 6/08/15; response due by 6/29/15; reply due by 7/06/15.  All motions in limine, jury instructions and witness lists are due within one (1) week of the final pretrial date.   Any alibi notices must be filed according to statute.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Devontae O'Dezen Bracken in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Devontae O'Dezen Bracken in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: MPD Detective Christopher Fritz.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MONIQUE F.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Devontae O'Dezen Bracken in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Motion to dismiss FOR LACK OF PROBABLE CAUSE by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
